title.rendered: Jason Owen’s Sandbox Productions and Sony Music Entertainment’s Premium Content Division Announce Multi-Year Production & Development Agreement

content.rendered:
Collaboration Launches with Development of Definitive June Carter Cash Documentary Film and Debut of Performance Storytelling Film LOVE, TOM on Paramount+

Partnership Will Develop Robust Slate of Original Content Across Multiple Platforms Featuring Stories From America’s South

NEW YORK AND NASHVILLE – February 28, 2022 – Award-winning producer, recording artist manager and President/CEO of Sandbox Entertainment Jason Owen and Sony Music Entertainment’s (SME) Premium Content Division today announced a development agreement with Sandbox Productions to produce a slate of original long-form projects across multiple platforms and distributors. 

Under the multi-year agreement, Sandbox Productions, led by Jason Owen, and SME will collaborate on the creation, production and distribution of scripted and unscripted content across TV, film and digital formats, including the development of the definitive June Carter Cash documentary film. Featuring unprecedented access to the Cash Estate, including never before heard interviews with Cash family members and archival footage, the film will trace June Carter’s roots and showcase her incredible journey to country music superstardom. 

The companies have also partnered on the premiere of LOVE,TOM, a letter of hope narrated over the course of a single night in Nashville by GRAMMY, Oscar and Golden Globe nominated songwriter Tom Douglas. The standalone and structured performance is now streaming on Paramount+. 

Through the partnership Sandbox Productions, will consult and collaborate with a wide network of writers, directors, on-screen talent, musical artists, and visual artists to provide creative direction on additional new and developing projects. A powerhouse producer and acclaimed manager, Owen will tap into his vast expertise and deep connections within the music industry to create a library of projects that tell the stories of music, history, and culture set in the south  

SME’s Premium Content Division will distribute and finance all joint-venture projects.  

Commenting on the partnership, Jason Owen said, “I’m thrilled to announce Sandbox Production’s partnership with SME’s Premium Content Division. Tom Mackay and his team at SME share the same enthusiasm and passion for thinking big picture and value the importance of creating content that is engaging for all audiences. We have a lot more film and TV projects currently in development and I can’t wait for everyone to see these incredible works come to fruition.” 

“Jason is at the forefront of storytelling in Nashville and his relationships across the entire entertainment industry make him an incredible partner to work with,” said Tom Mackay, President, Premium Content, Sony Music Entertainment. “We are inspired by his vision to bring new life to beloved stories and look forward to continuing our relationship with Sandbox Productions to reach new audiences across all formats.”

Sony Music Entertainment and Sandbox Productions are committed to expanding content opportunities for artists and creators. This deal exemplifies Sony Music Entertainment’s value proposition to creatives who are looking to explore innovative ways to develop content for new audiences.
